collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Cockleburrs are summer plants that grow between two to four feet tall and reseed themselves to reproduce. Cockleburrs are known to grow in colonies.
The Sugar Pinecone will mature for two years before the seed falls off of the tree.
Muskrats were named after their odor and are semi-aquatic rodents with a rudder-like tail, partially webbed back feet, and fur that maintain air for both insulation and buoyancy.

collectionItem.Description: taxidermy animal with brown fur mounted on wooden board
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Mink, a semi-aquatic mammal, hunts water voles, fish, birds as well as other game with a devastating effect on native species. Their preferred times to hunt are at dusk and during the night, in which they capture their prey mercilessly.

collectionItem.Material: wood, fur, hide, horn, beads, cowrie shells, rattan, raffia
collectionItem.Description: Elephant mask made of cowrie shells, beads, fur, hid, raffia, rattan and horn
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: This mask from the Kuba culture of the Democratic Republic of the Congo is used in funeral ceremonies for nobles. The white color of the cowrie shells is associated with the bones of ancestors and serves as a sign of mourning.

collectionItem.Description: carved wooden raven mask with black, white and red paint
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: The raven mask comes from indigenous groups in North America, much like the groups who created the totem pole.

collectionItem.Description: green, yellow, and red mask with horns and two circles and an animalistic face
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: This devil Sri Lankan wooden mask represents the demon worshiping aspect of the island's culture.

collectionItem.Description: shell with dark brown markings and a variety of ridges on body, one extremely large, one medium and one smaller shell
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Heteropods are active predators keenly adapted to life in the open ocean. They have large eyes and a "foot" that forms a swimming fin.

collectionItem.Description: extremely large shell with pointy "horns", white in color, some brown spots on body. One shell has light brown stripes on lip.
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: The common horned helmet shell is inhibited by a sea snail, and received the name horned helmet due to the horns on the back of the shell.

collectionItem.Description: Abalone shells of different colors (pink, light brown, white, gray, green) and sizes (large to small)
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Abalone shells are home to sea snails, and are known for their flourescent interior.

collectionItem.Description: small and large triangular shaped shells with circular bases, white in color with dark purple or pink markings
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Common top shells are home toherbavoric sea snails.

collectionItem.Description: slab of rock with plant remains embedded or imprinted; foliage of a "seed fern" (extinct)
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: The first seed plants appeared 350 million years ago, allowing plants to reproduce on land rather than depending on water for reproduction.

collectionItem.Description: layered metamorphic rock with garnet, diopside, and wollastonite
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Originally a layered rock, this rock went through a metamorphic phase. This type of skarn is most commonly found around tungsten, which if found in lightbulbs.

The iron meteorite comes from space, and is all that is left of the core of large asteroid shattered by collisions billions of years ago. The crystalline structure of this piece hints at the size of the asteroid.

A Roman myth said that the amethyst was colored by the god of wine and offered protection from drunkenness, however scientist know that the iron impurities altered by natural radiation absorbed all but red and blue light to color the amethyst purple.
Scale trees lived 350 million years ago in vast coal swamps throughout what is now the United States.
Bark maybe found on trees, yet this decomposable material may also leave fossils like other animals. For more information about fossilized bark check out the petrified wood in the fossil drawer.

collectionItem.Description: small green leaves with spiny ends
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Holly leaves are evergreens known for their leathery texture and stiffness. Holly can grow up to thirty feet tall if in the right conditions.

collectionItem.CountryOfOriginRange: Panama, along the Andes to Ecuador, Bolivia, Peru
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Pinecones carry the seeds of tree. After reaching a point of maturity, the pinecones falls off of the tree, placing the seeds of the tree in the ground in hopes of a new tree growing.
Pinecones carry the seeds of tree. After reaching a point of maturity, the pinecones falls off of the tree, placing the seeds of the tree in the ground in hopes of a new tree growing.
Pinecones carry the seeds of tree. After reaching a point of maturity, the pinecones falls off of the tree, placing the seeds of the tree in the ground in hopes of a new tree growing.
Pinecones carry the seeds of tree. After reaching a point of maturity, the pinecones falls off of the tree, placing the seeds of the tree in the ground in hopes of a new tree growing.
Pinecones carry the seeds of tree. After reaching a point of maturity, the pinecones falls off of the tree, placing the seeds of the tree in the ground in hopes of a new tree growing.
Acorns are most commonly known as food for squirrels, as well as being the seeds of many trees.

Milkweed’s name originates from the milky juice that emanates from the plant, some of which may be toxic. Monarch Butterfly larvas survive off of milkweed during their initial month before creating their cocoons.

collectionItem.Description: piece of soft, white cotton attached to plant
collectionItem.CountryOfOriginRange: subtropical regions; the Americas, Africa, India, Pakistan
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Cotton is the material that surrounds and protects the seed of the cotton plant and is used in many textile products, especially clothing.

Giant Sequoia pinecones develop for only the spring and summer months, however, the seeds only fall out in a dry climate, allowing for the cones to shrink and the seeds to fall out. Giant Sequoias take 20 years to mature, yet the oldest one is said to be 3,000 years old.

Coyotes are one of the most adaptable mammals in North America, able to live in a variety of geographical locations across the continent. They posse teeth that are blade- like with sharp shearing edges that can cut their food like scissors cut paper.
Red Squirrels are extremely vocal with either chatter or barking at intruders for up to an hour. During their mating season, they make distinctive calls that sound similar to the buzz of cicadas.
Mice are the prey of Red Tailed Hawks, coyotes and many other carnivores, while mice are omnivores. These types of mice are known for their speed and agility, hence the nickname of “deer mice”.

Northern short – tailed shrews have poisonous salvia which they use to paralyze their prey to eat at a later time. Known for their lack of eye site, shrews use echolocation to navigate within their underground nests, and are active for about 4.5 minutes before taking a 24 minute rest during the day.

Bats are the only mammals to evolve to use true power flight, like birds. Bats are nocturnal, and use echolocation to find their food – fruit, insects, fist or a variety of food types – during the night.
Voles may nest both above and below the surface depending on habitat of each vole.

collectionItem.Description: small jaw bone with rodent front teeth
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Humans, also known as homo sapiens sapiens, inhabit all corner of the Earth, with a population that is continuously climbing.
The Aztec King's, Tezcatlipola, animal companion was a jaguar.

collectionItem.Description: paper-mache animal mask with 2 black horns near mouth
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Masks, like this one, were used in ceremonies that included dancing and celebrations.
Within the Mexican culture, masks were used to represent ones animal companion.
Copper can be found in several forms, such as crystals, nuggets, rosettes and dendrites. Copper can be mined from rocks where less than one percent of the rock is copper.

collectionItem.Description: two different looking rocks: one gray rock, rough, with many shiny gold specks; the other looks like two shiny gold squares stuck together (mineral)
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Pyrite is also known as “fool’s gold” due to its metallic appearance similar to gold.

collectionItem.Description: dark green mineral with some white and brown streaks
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Malachite’s green coloring comes from the presences of Copper within the crystals of the mineral. The sizes of the crystals dictate the shade of green of malachite - the smaller the crystals the lighter the green, while the larger the crystals the darker the green hue.

collectionItem.Description: dark green mineral with some brown and light blue streaks
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Malachite’s green coloring comes from the presences of Copper within the crystals of the mineral. The sizes of the crystals dictate the shade of green of malachite - the smaller the crystals the lighter the green, while the larger the crystals the darker the green hue.
When put under UV lighting, Barite emanates a neon orange color.

collectionItem.Description: looks like a cluster of small rocks, has reddish dust over it

collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Gold and quartz are a commonly associated, due to the regular occurrence of gold atoms attached to quartz.

collectionItem.Description: pink mineral with starburst crystal formations
Mostly pink rock with black patterns
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Rhodonite can be found in Franklin – Sterling site, which is home to 330 out of 4,000 minerals known today.

collectionItem.Description: minerals with shiny metallic blue color

collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Rock crystals are clear colorless quartz used for decorative objects such as carving, chandeliers and crystal balls.

collectionItem.Description: clear see-through mineral with distinct crystal features
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Calcite crystals are all arrangements of calcium, carbon, and oxygen atoms in a pattern with three fold symmetry. But research suggest that impurities along with differences in temperature and composition cause the crystal faces to grow in all different rates – creating many variations to one shape.

collectionItem.Description: white mineral with black rock interspersed

collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Hermatite is a major ore of iron.

collectionItem.Description: rock with rough outer surface and turquoise bubbly-looking mineral inside
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Smithsonite, an ore of zinc, changes colors depending on impurities in the crystals. This mineral was named after the founder of the Smithsonian Institution, James Smithson, who first recognized it as a distinct mineral.

collectionItem.Description: small, orange and brown, thin spindly arms.
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: This deepwater coral live between 21 meters and 494 meters deep in the ocean, while thriving at around 473 meters. Coral is a living animal that is an important part of the ocean, and has left behind fossils since 650 million years ago to the Precambrian period.

Sand dollars originally had arms much more simularly to a starfish, but with evolution, they now have cilica (hair like material) covered spines that allow them to move about the ocean floor. Due to their shells, the sand dollar has very few predators.
Thin fingered coral is actually a skeleton made of the mineral aragonite.

collectionItem.Description: white shells with very long spines
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: The venus comb shell is home to a predatory sea snail, in which the spines off of the shell proved protection.
Starfish are echinoderms, a group of ocean animals with 5-part radial symmetry.

The horseshoe crab is a 'living fossil': similar species were present during the Triassic and Devonian periods, 230-400 million years ago. Despite their common name, they are not crabs but are related to arachnids (spiders, scorpions, ticks and mites), and are the closest living relatives of the now extinct trilobites.
Starfish are echinoderms, a group of ocean animals with 5-part radial symmetry.

collectionItem.CountryOfOriginRange: Bermuda to Curacao, including the Florida Keys and Western Caribbean
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Sea fans are carnivorous passive eaters that obtain their food by growing in the path of a sea current so as to easily consume zooplankton.

collectionItem.Description: slabs of black rock with plant imprints; foliage of a "seed fern" (extinct); (1) true fern foliage
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: The first seed plants appeared 350 million years ago, allowing plants to reproduce on land rather than depending on water for reproduction.
Scientists have found fossilized corals dating back 650 million years ago to the Precambrian period.

collectionItem.Description: petrified wood, white, light brown and gray in color
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Petrified wood is wood that has absorbed minerals and decayed gradually over hundreds of thousands of years. Over time, these minerals crystallize and replace the organic material, essentially turning the wood into stone.
These marine animals live in colonies, secreting calcium carbonate to create the coral reefs which serve as a habitat for diverse marine life.

collectionItem.Description: slab of rock with fossil leaf imprints
replica of a cast of Beecher's Trilobites
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: Trilobites appeared 500 million years ago. These arthropods are related to today's horseshoe crabs and lobsters.

collectionItem.Description: long section of flattened fossil plant - black - giant lycpsid tree root; circular specimen - horsetail tree trunk
collectionItem.InterestingFacts: This egg belongs to the now extinct Elephant Bird from Madagascar.
